page.title: 13TUNSTEAD FARM
page.content: Tunstead Farm covers an area of 490 acres. The farm house was built in the 18th century, whereas most of the out-buildings are quite modern. The farmhouse is owned by Mr.Fotherby, the farmer, but{most of the land is owned {by I.C.I., who moved the farm in 1979 {from Great Rocks Farm, as they were {extending the quarry workings onto the {land where the farm house stood.} The land is used for grazing for the 390 cows and 380 sheep, but in the summer time some grass is harvested for hay and sileage to feed the animals during a 7-month winter. The cows are divided into 3 groups: calves, milking and dry. The sheep are used for their wool and meat. Mr.Fotherby has been farming all of his life, and he has thoroughly enjoyed it.
